thread.title: Statistically speaking: Auburn sees minimal offensive improvement from four-overtime loss
thread.title_full: Statistically speaking: Auburn sees minimal offensive improvement from four-overtime loss | AL.com

author: James Crepea | jcrepea@al.com
title: Statistically speaking: Auburn sees minimal offensive improvement from four-overtime loss
text:
Even with four overtime periods of play Auburn saw minimal improvement to its offensive statistics following Saturday's 54-46 loss to Arkansas.
Auburn (4-3, 1-3 SEC) saw a small uptick in its passing stats after Sean White threw for 254 yards. White could have had a lot more if not for at least seven drops by Auburn receivers .
Peyton Barber added another four rushing scores but the Tigers remain 12th in the SEC in total offense (363.1 yards per game).
RELATED: Arkansas loss 'like a nagging stab' to Auburn's defense
Auburn's defense, which was already last in the conference in total defense, dropped to last in scoring following the 54 points from the Razorbacks, though 30 came after regulation.
RUSHING OFFENSE
Last week: 183.7 (5th, 49th)
This week: 180.6 (6th, 52nd)
Why: Auburn had 162 yards, with 62 coming in overtime
PASSING OFFENSE
Last week: 170.7 (13th, 110th)
This week: 182.6 (12th, 103rd)
Why: Sean White threw for 254 yards, one yard shy of the season-high from a week earlier
PASS EFFICIENCY OFFENSE
Last week: 124.91 (10th, 79th)
This week: 126.46 (11th, 82nd)
Why: White was 19 for 32 with no interceptions
TOTAL OFFENSE
Last week: 354.3 (12th, 97th)
This week: 363.1 (12th, 92nd)
Why: Auburn gained a season-best 416 yards, with 76 coming during overtime
SCORING OFFENSE
Last week: 25.5 (10th, 89th)
This week: 28.4 (9th, 71st)
Why: Auburn scored 46 points, including 24 in regulation
SACKS ALLOWED
Last week: 10 sacks, 1.67 per game (7th, 49th)
This week: 11 sacks, 1.57 per game (5th, 39th)
Why: Arkansas recorded one sack
THIRD-DOWN CONVERSIONS
Last week: 46.7 percent (1st, 18th)
This week: 46.7 percent (1st, 16th)
Why: Auburn was 8 for 17 on third down
RED ZONE OFFENSE
Last week: 81.8 percent (10th, 85th)
This week: 85.7 percent (6th, 52nd)
Why: Auburn scored touchdowns on all six of its trips inside the red zone
RUSHING DEFENSE
Last week: 197.7 (13th, 101st)
This week: 199.9 (12th, 100th)
Why: Auburn allowed 213 rushing yards, with 187 coming in regulation
PASSING DEFENSE
Last week: 228.5 (11th, 69th)
This week: 230.7 (11th, 73rd)
Why: Arkansas threw for 244 yards
PASS EFFICIENCY DEFENSE
Last week: 120.46 (14th, 93nd)
This week: 124.3 (10th, 62nd)
Why: Brandon Allen was 19 for 31 with an interception
TOTAL DEFENSE
Last week: 426.2 (14th, 86th)
This week: 430.6 (14th, 99th)
Why: Auburn allowed 457 yards
SCORING DEFENSE
Last week: 25.7 (12th, 61st)
This week: 29.7 (14th, 88th)
Why: Kentucky scored 54 points
SACKS
Last week: 10 sacks, 1.67 per game (11th, 86th)
This week: 11 sacks, 1.57 per game (13th, 98th)
Why: Auburn recorded one sack
THIRD-DOWN DEFENSE
Last week: 45.7 percent (14th, 111th)
This week: 47.4 percent (14th, 118th)
Why: Arkansas was 9 for 16 on third down
RED ZONE DEFENSE
Last week: 80.8 percent (9th, 47th)
This week: 84.4 percent (13th, 73rd)
Why: The Razorbacks scored on all six trips to the red zone with five touchdowns
NET PUNTING
Last week: 39.74 (7th, 27th)
This week: 38.86 (7th, 40th)
Why: Kevin Phillips averaged 36.2 yards on six punts
KICK RETURNS
Last week: 29.42 (2nd, 4th)
This week: 29.09 (2nd, 4th)
Why: Auburn had three returns for 81 yards
PUNT RETURNS
Last week: 7.50 yards per return (11th, 72nd)
This week: 7.50 yards per return (12th, 71st)
Why: Auburn had no punt returns
TURNOVER MARGIN
Last week: zero, zero per game (9th, 71st)
This week: plus-one, 0.14 per game (6th, 62ndt)
Why: Auburn had an interception and did not turn the ball over
PENALTY YARDS PER GAME
Last week: 41.67 (6th, 21st)
This week: 39.29 (3rd, 12th)
Why: Auburn committed two penalties for 25 yards
Other stats of note:
- Peyton Barber's 12 rushing touchdowns are tied for 7th nationally
